Package fr.sorbonne_u.components.reflection.ports

Class IntrospectionOutboundPort

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.rmi.server.RemoteObject
      • java.rmi.server.RemoteServer
        • java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
          • fr.sorbonne_u.components.AbstractPort
            • fr.sorbonne_u.components.ports.AbstractOutboundPort
              • fr.sorbonne_u.components.reflection.ports.IntrospectionOutboundPort
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ComponentInterface, OfferedCI, RequiredCI, OutboundPortI, PortI, IntrospectionCI, Serializable, Remote
    public class IntrospectionOutboundPort
extends AbstractOutboundPort
implements IntrospectionCI
    The class IntrospectionOutboundPort defines the outbound port associated the interface IntrospectionI.

    Description

    Invariant

     invariant              true

    Created on : 2018-02-16

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • hasSerialisedExecution

        public boolean hasSerialisedExecution()
                               throws Exception
        Description copied from interface: IntrospectionCI
        return true if the component guarantees a serialised execution of its services.

        In the baseline definition, this returns true if the component has its own threads and if the total number of threads is exactly one. A component can guarantee its serialised execution in other ways and then should redefine the method for example, by making all externally callable services implemented by synchronised methods.

        Contract

         pre    true            // no precondition.
 post   true            // no postcondition.
        Specified by:
        hasSerialisedExecution in interface IntrospectionCI
        Returns:
        true if the component guarantees a serialised execution of its services.
        Throws:
        Exception - to do.
        See Also:
        IntrospectionCI.hasSerialisedExecution()
